title: Need other league players input in an unbiased manner.
body:
Riot deleted my last post of this without justification so I will post this again.  Riot - If you feel the need to delete this thread, adhere to your own terms of service and notify me for the reasoning or have your legal team contact me directly to explain.

Besides that, What would you do if you're playing adc (Lucian) with a Lux support against a Jhin/Vel.  We started the game off right with the lux standing at the tower insteading helping leash for the jungler.  Not gaining vision or positioning, just standing afk at tower.  Upon getting to lane late and losing 3 melee minions, I get there and lux is spamming her lvl 1 E at the waves instead of poking while vel is spamming hers at me.  I asked her politely to stop hitting the wave.  She continued to do this through the third wave forcing me to b from taking endless poke while they just zoned me off.  Push comes to shove, this continues for the first 10 minutes of the game and I got absolutely tired of it.  I started to flame this player after asking nicely.  I was a plat player the prior 2 seasons and now I'm in silver elo (took 8 afks in promos to get brought back down to elo hell).  Was a support main but can play all roles at a gold 1 level.  ADC/Supp being ones i was playing in plat.  I continued to hard flame this player because she kept doing it after the team started flaming me for being down 60 cs at 18 minutes or so.  They don't realize an aggro lane like that you can't farm as a medium range while your own support is just screwing waves not allowing for last hitting and not poking opposing lane while they are free aggro.  Team ended up flaming me for being so far behind and why this Jhin was ahead so i flamed right back at them.  Explaining time and time again to watch this lux's play.  So here is my question to my fellow league players on what I should have done.

1) Ignore this players behavior, end up losing the game from it being a 3v5 since both myself and lux would be useless, putting me in a position to be reported for intentional feeding which wouldn't have been the case but the automated system would record it as such giving me a ban.
2) Afk out so my time is not wasted and i wouldn't have flamed this lux.  I also would have been reported for leaving the game.
3) Flame this player since asking nicely wasn't doing it.  (This got me a 10game chat restriction which i feel is unjust).  
4) Do nothing and keep playing which puts me in violation of terms of inting as being so far behind as a lucian with no support means i couldn't even farm safely under tower.  (Team refused to buy vision as well.  I was behind yet the only one trying to keep vision)
5) Do nothing and report this player at the end of the game for something that is not reportable.  This player trolls like no other and is in no violation costing other players 20-30 minutes of their day and riot refuses to punish players like this forcing people like myself to get fed up and take it into our own hands. 

Again Riot, If you feel the need to be embarrassed about how your poor matchmaking MMR system is along with not wanting your audience to see how you appeal to the masses and not addressing this trolling issue I need your legal team to contact me.  If this is taken down i will put it right back up as this is in no way shape or form a violation of your terms of service as i just read it top to bottom twice to make sure my last one wasn't at fault for it getting deleted.

Flaming them just ruins the game for the other players and gets both of you reported soooooooooo, ignore them, play the best you can and report them in post game

I check na.op.gg the next 48 hours to see if they are still playing.  Not once have i seen a player punished.  I agree with your sentiment that they have access to these system but you realize there is no way on gods green earth they have the manpower to review every case of grieving with how many games are played?  It's pretty much just a feel good button to hit at the end of the game giving players false hope they'll correct those players.
But it the report feature does nothing, how would you explain those people who come to these boards with bans and chat restrictions?

If it's a singular person it will be interpreted as that player just had a bad game.  I don't know how much more i can do outside of constantly record these games for others to see and ask riot and other league players for answers.

You're contradicting your previous statement. 

> It's pretty much just a feel good button to hit at the end of the game giving players false hope they'll correct those players.

It taking more than one game of poor behavior reports to get someone punished directly contradicts your claim that the report does nothing.

Negative, I'll elaborate.  

If X amount of players within that game report the player, an automated ban or restriction will take effect.

If only yourself reports the player because you're the only one seeing it then it becomes just a feel good button.

>If X amount of players within that game report the player, an automated ban or restriction will take effect.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Tantram,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=HALtvP5a,comment-id=00000000000000010000000000000000000100000001,timestamp=2018-04-24T21:45:22.296+0000)
>
> 'Ganging up on' someone via reports doesn't do anything. 1 report is the same as 9. More reports does not increase the chance of a game being reviewed. All it takes is a single report.

https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752884-Reporting-a-Player

"Do not ask other players in the match to report the offending player. **It only takes one report for our systems to review a game. Additional reports will not do anything for the offending player**; however as mentioned above, it could open yourself up to a report of your own; especially if you are derailing the match by constantly demanding reports of other players."

second bullet point under "things to avoid"

Have you ever played in Bronze, silver or gold?  Nearly every game someone on one of the teams is asking to report someone else.  This is a rule that's not enforced.  It's like an MCL provision in Michigan that says a wife cannot lawfully haircut without her husbands permission.  That is a 93 day misdemenour that's on the books.  However, it is not enforced just like this isn't.  There is not a single case I've seen someone get banned/restricted for asking for that.  I've been guilty of doing this myself way back when, when i first started this game and not so much as a notification of me being in violation.  

Basic math alone, Say the average league player plays 3 games a day.  say there are 100,000 players playing.  That's 300,000 divided by 10.  That makes 30,000 games.  The average game length i see in current meta is 30 minutes.  Now 30 minutes multiplied by 30,000 games is 900,000 minutes of game play or 15,000 hours of gameplay.  The average person works 8 hours a day so 15,000 / 8 hours is 1,875 people.  If one person reported every game it would take 1,875 people on a scale of 100,000 players playing 3 games to review these which is not possible thus how I can attest to they do not have the manpower to review these cases.  I don't blindly follow FAQ's and well articulated articles.  I do research of my own and this is not acceptable.  Most players can agree the matchmaking system has been faulted ever since they switched the system to accept 2 roles to keep q times lower for the solo laners or people that only play one lane.

I'm more inclined to believe both the public message by Riot and a specific Riot that is in charge of the programming behind the behavioral system than you.

>Basic math alone, Say the average league player plays 3 games a day. say there are 100,000 players playing. That's 300,000 divided by 10. That makes 30,000 games. The average game length i see in current meta is 30 minutes. Now 30 minutes multiplied by 30,000 games is 900,000 minutes of game play or 15,000 hours of gameplay. The average person works 8 hours a day so 15,000 / 8 hours is 1,875 people. If one person reported every game it would take 1,875 people on a scale of 100,000 players playing 3 games to review these which is not possible thus how I can attest to they do not have the manpower to review these cases.

That was a lot of math and assumptions to counter something that they never claimed in the first place. Nowhere in the post that I quoted or the FAQ does it state that they hand-review every case.

And for that I cannot blame you and respect what you're saying.  Example, If i recorded games, formatted them, put them on youtube for you to see would that help?  If not that, I can also use my prior recording of individuals and spend some time this weekend when i'm not a work compiling all that I've gathered for you to see through my eyes.  Just like everything else in life, people see things from different perspectives and I understand fully without proof my wording is just banter itself.  I will surely go back through this weekend and place these on youtube so you can see through my eyes what is going on causing extreme frustration along with letting other players who are being victims of wasting their time and money like myself to come forward and try to get this fixed.  No system is perfect but this truly needs to be reviewed up and down.

Regardless of your own experiences they are a sample size of one from the perspective of someone who doesn't have all the information that goes into the decision when the system hands out punishments.

You can't see what their current standing in the system is. You can't see if they previously had poor behavior and if they were on the edge of the next ban. You can't even see if they get handed a chat restriction because the feedback system has been known to be sporadic at best.

You, as one person, get the perspective of a single game of the other person. My own experiences, also a sample size of one, has me reporting very few people in the first place. I just don't see that many people with poor behavior in my PvP games. At the very least it shows that a person's experiences with the game can be vastly different so either case is hardly good proof of how the community as a whole is functioning.

Riot however has all the information and the data across all games.
